cmake-tools.configuration.title: CMake Tools configuration
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.cmakePat: Name/path of the CMake executable to use.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.buildDir: The directory where CMake build files will go.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.installP: The directory where CMake installed files will go.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.sourceDi: The directory of the root CMakeLists.txt file.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.buildBef: Build the target before running it.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.clearOut: Clear build output before each build.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.configur: CMake variables to set on the command line.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.cacheIni: Path to a cache-initializing CMake file.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.preferre: The preferred CMake generator(s) to use when configuring (tried in order of listing).
The CMake toolset to use when configuring.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.platform: The CMake platform to use when configuring.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.configur: Additional arguments to pass to CMake when configuring.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.buildArg: Additional arguments to pass to CMake when building.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.buildToo: Additional arguments to pass to the underlying build tool when building.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.parallel: The number of parallel build jobs. Use zero to automatically detect the number of CPUs. Setting this to 1 will disable build parallelism.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.ctestPat: Path to CTest executable. If null, will be inferred from cmake.cmakePath (recommended to leave null).
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.ctest.pa: The number of parallel test jobs. Use zero to use the value of cmake.parallelJobs.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.parseBui: Parse compiler output for warnings and errors.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.enabledO: Output parsers to use. Supported parsers 'cmake', 'gcc', 'gnuld' for GNULD-style linker output, 'msvc' for Microsoft Visual C++, 'ghs' for the Green Hills compiler with --no_wrap_diagnostics --brief_diagnostics, and 'diab' for the Wind River Diab compiler.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.debugCon: The debug configuration to use when debugging a target.
Visual Studio debugger symbol search paths.
Paths for GDB or LLDB to search for .so files.
Launch an external console for the program.
Tell what types of messages should be logged to the console.
.natvis file to be used when debugging.
Arguments to pass to program command line.
Set the working directory for the program.
Path to gdb or lldb debugger.
Stop at the entry point of the target.
Command to set up gdb or lldb.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.defaultV: Optimize for speed - exclude debug information.
Optimize for smallest binary size - exclude debug information.
Optimize for speed - include debug information.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.ctestDef: Arguments passed by default to CTest.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.environm: Environment variables to set when running CMake commands.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.configur: Environment variables to pass to CMake during configure.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.buildEnv: Environment variables to pass to CMake during build.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.testEnvi: Environment variables to pass to CTest.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.mingwSea: Directories where MinGW may be installed.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.emscript: Directories where Emscripten may be installed.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.mergedCo: Recursively collect and merge all compile_commands.json found in the cmake.buildDirectory.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.copyComp: Copy compile_commands.json to this location after a successful configure.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.configur: Automatically configure CMake project directories when they are opened.
Automatically configure CMake project directories when cmake.sourceDirectory or CMakeLists.txt content are saved.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.setBuild: Set CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE also on multi config generators
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.skipConf: Skip over the configure process if cache is present.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.cmakeCom: The protocol used to communicate between the extension and CMake
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.ignoreKi: Do not use the kit environment variables when running CMake commands.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.buildTas: Build using tasks.json instead of internal process.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.outputLo: Encoding of the output from external commands (eg.cmake -- build).
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.enableTr: Enable trace logging to file and console (very noisy).
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.touchbar: Configures how the extension displays the buttons on a MacBook Touch Bar
Show Touch Bar buttons on supported systems.
Do not show Touch Bar buttons.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.statusba: Configures how the extension displays the buttons in the status bar.
Configures the settings for individual status bar buttons. These settings overwrite the more general 'cmake.statusbar.visibility' setting.
Configures how the extension displays this button in the status bar.
Enables a change in color for this button depending on test results.
Configures the maximum length of visible text in 'compact' mode.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.addition: Array of paths to custom kit files
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.useCMake: Use CMakePresets.json to configure drive CMake configure, build, and test. When using CMakePresets.json, kits, variants, and some settings in settings.json will be ignored.
cmake-tools.configuration.cmake.allowCom: Allow the use of JSON extensions such as comments in CMakePresets.json. Please note that your CMakePresets.json file may be considered invalid by other IDEs or on the command line if you use non-standard JSON.
